description.narrative:
1. Tourism development: By developing critical tourism infrastructures, the Project will (i) enable tourists extend their stay in Ha Long; (ii) stimulate the development of a new international tourism destination in Phu Quoc island; and (iii) upgrade the supply of international standard accommodation in Vientiane.
2. Job creation and local linkages: The Project is expected to create a number of skilled job opportunities, including a significant proportion of female jobs, and stimulate demand for locally-sourced materials, services and labor which are mostly provided by local small and medium enterprises.
3. Environmental and Social (E&S) standard setting: The Project is expected to exhibit high level of E&S compliance in areas such as waste treatment and land acquisition, which is expected to have a strong demonstration effect to other property developments in the same area.

BIM Land Joint Stock Company (BIM Land or the Company) is a leading tourism property developer in Vietnam. The Company builds, sells and/or operates properties that cater to both domestic and international tourists needs including hotels, residences and retail space. BIM Lands projects are all located in tourism areas such as Ha Long city in Quang Ninh province or the Phu Quoc island in Kien Giang province. Recently, the Company has expanded into neighboring Laos, where it is replicating its successful tourism property development model in Vientiane. IFC is providing debt financing to the Company to support the Project which consists of: (i) the Intercontinental resort in Ha Long bay, Vietnam, comprising of a hotel and residences; (ii) the Citadines apartments and a water park in Phu Quoc island, Vietnam; and (iii) the Holiday Inn in Vientiane, Laos, comprising of a hotel, office and retail spaces.
